measured_by: variance of a Gaussian distribution over sensory information
justification: The text states that "perceptual uncertainty is present when sensory information is ambiguous… and a common measure of perceptual uncertainty is the variance of a Gaussian distribution."
Under the heading of risk, the article explains that "Risk is present when the outcomes of a decision cannot be perfectly predicted and is usually defined by the variance of potential outcomes."

measured_by: variance of a probability distribution over outcome probabilities
justification: The section on estimation uncertainty notes that this construct "can also be quantified by the variance of a probability distribution," reflecting the decision-maker’s incomplete knowledge of outcome probabilities.

measured_by: coefficient of variation (standard deviation divided by expected value)
justification: When discussing mean-variance models, the article introduces the coefficient of variation, stating that "the coefficient of variation formalizes risk in terms of the standard deviation relative to the expected value of an option."
